Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> 1) Cross-chain communication = transference of information from one blockchain to another.   2) Nothing at Stake protection - protects proof of stake blockchains from double spend attacks . 3) Hard Drive scalability- when a blockchain gets too big that it becomes encumbersome to run, how does one shrink the space but maintain the integrity of the earlier records. 4) . Cluster scalability = how to coordinate things among a multiple blockchain project.  5 ) Mobile Dex = decentralized trading on your phone 6) feeless tx that don‚Äôt spam , pretty self explanatory. 7) Secondary Notary networks = if you wanted to make your own notary system and secure your own chain how would you do that.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> It can be discarded but most likely will be archived and used as a historical reference .  Saving on HD space, requires creating a new chain , same properties of the old chain with its genesis( or a reference in the genesis block )  as the last blockhash of the old chain. The new chain imports the old chains UTXO set ( everyone has their coins from the old chain with same privkey)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Simple analogy:  One giant book versus multiple smaller books
